citeinfo.title: Minnesota Trails: Division of Parks and Trails

descript.abstract: This dataset consists of a wide variety of trails within Minnesota that are maintained by the DNR Division of Parks and Trails as well as those maintained by Grant-In-Aid-funded trail clubs. In addition, the data include certain roads such as state park roads and campground spurs. Attributes for each trail segment include, among other things, trail name, Program Project Code, authorized trail uses, trail surface type, and trail width. The layer file available through Quick Layers provides a wide variety of display options that correspond to these descriptive attributes.
descript.purpose: This data set is designed to be used to map information regarding general trail locations, approved uses, surface type, and width.

timeperd.current: This data was collected from GPS, aerial photograph interpretation, and paper maps. 2003 - Present.

theme.themekey: transportation, trails, roads, biking, bicycling, mountain biking, hiking, trails, surface type, width, state trails, state water trails, horse trails, interpretive trails, self-guided trails, hiking club, ADA, Americans with Disabilities Act, ski trails, snowshoe, fat bike, dog sled, skijoring, inline skating, Off-Highway Vehicles, OHV, All-Terrain Vehicles, ATV, Off-Highway Motorcycles, OHM, Off-Road Vehicles, ORV, motorized, non-motorized, treadway

idinfo.useconst: These data are free for public use but cannot be sold or used as legal information and should be understood as an approximation of trail locations.

citeinfo.title: Trail, trail use, surface type, and segment width feature classes within the WHEELS SDE database

cntperp.cntorg: Minnesota DNR - Parks and Trails, Information Systems Team

dataqual.logic: Data are topologically correct using internal editing tools at the DNR.
dataqual.complete: This dataset includes all Division of Parks and Trails trails that have been physically constructed, using the best data available. Proposed alignments and trail segments not yet built are excluded.

procstep.procdesc: This dataset is derived and regularly updated from the DNR WHEELS SDE database.

spdoinfo.indspref: State Park, Recreation Area, and Wayside Trails

enttyp.enttypd: Minnesota Trails: Division of Parks and Trails Attribute Table. Field names refer to the actual names of fields in the table; displayed field names (aliases) are defined in the field definition where applicable.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Field alias: Trail Name. The name of the trail.
Field alias: Alternate Name. A second name for the trail, if applicable.
Field alias: Program Project. The 8-character Program/Project Code of the trail, if applicable.
Field alias: Unit Name. Unit Name for the trail.
Field alias: Administered By. Division or entity that administers this trail.
Field alias: Maintained By. Division or entity that maintains the trail.
Field alias: Hiking. Trail may be used for hiking. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Hiking Club. Trail is a hiking club trail. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Hunter Walking Trail. Trail is used for hunter walking access. 1 = True, 0 = False. (Note that this is not a reliable source for Hunter Walking Trails.)
Field alias: Self-Guided. Trail is a self-guided trail. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Interpretive Use. Trail is an interpretive trail. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Sidewalk Access Path Portage. Trail is a sidewalk, access path, or a portage. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Americans with Disabilities Act. Trail complies with requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Horse. Trail allows travel by horseback. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Bike. Trail may be used by bikes. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Mountain Bike. Trail may be used by mountain bikes. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Inline Skate. Trail may be used by inline skaters. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Winter Hike. Trail can be used for winter hiking. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Cross Country Ski. Trail may be used for cross-country skiing during winter months. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Skate Ski. Trail may be used for skate-skiing. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Snowshoe. Trail may be used for snowshoeing. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Sled Dog. Trail may be traveled by dog sled. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Skijoring. Trail may be used for skijoring. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Off-Highway Motorcycle. Trail may be used by off-highway motorcycles. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: ATV Class 1. Trail may be used by Class 1 All-Terrain Vehicles. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: ATV Class 2. Trail may be used by Class 2 All-Terrain Vehicles. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Off-Road Vehicle. Trail may be used by Off-Road Vehicles. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Motorized Watercraft. Trail may be used by motorized watercraft. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Nonmotorized Watercraft. Trail may be used by non-motorized watercraft. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Abandoned Use. Trail is abandoned. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Treadway. Feature is a road. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Road Name. Name of the road, if applicable. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Public Use. This road is open for public use. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Spur. Road is a spur, such as a campground spur. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Service Road. This road is a service road. 1 = True, 0 = False.
Field alias: Other/Comment. Comments not included within the other fields.
Field alias: Surface Type. Description of the surface type of the trail or road.
Field alias: Width. Describes the width of the trail or road. If the field is blank, the width has not been determined.
Field alias: Length (Miles). Length of trail or road in miles.
System-assigned unique identifier.
Length of trail or road segment in meters.
